name: Automate SEO Content Creation with Google SERP, Claude AI, and WordPress

user.name: Eugen
user.bio:
Data- & Workflow Automation. 
10+ years of experience in automating data onboarding, data management and workflow optimization in the energy trading environment.

description:
## üë• Who the Automation is for This automation is perfect for bloggers, solopreneurs, business owners, and marketing teams who want to **scale SEO content creation**. Instead of spending hours on research and drafting, you can go from a single keyword idea to a ready-to-edit WordPress draft in minutes.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How the Automation Works **Collect keywords** in a Google Sheet and mark the ones you want as ‚Äúprioritized.‚Äù Click ‚ÄúPrepare Content‚Äù ‚Üí your keyword(s) are sent to n8n. n8n pulls the top 10 Google **SERP** results. **AI analyzes competitors** (tone, content type, gaps) and creates a **content brief.** Another AI generates a **blog draft** based on the brief. The draft is automatically uploaded to WordPress and your sheet updates. üëâ In short: **Keyword ‚Üí SERP ‚Üí Brief ‚Üí Draft ‚Üí WordPress.**

## üõ† How to Set Up [Full Setup Guide](https://opaque-face-45b.notion.site/Keyword-to-Blog-Post-Automation-221f1bceaabe808fb4efdc7c7be71bac) Copy the Google Sheets Template. Import the workflow into n8n. Add your API keys: Google Custom Search, Claude AI, and WordPress credentials. Test the webhook connection from Google Sheets. **üéâ Done ‚Äî you now have a one-click pipeline from keyword idea to WordPress draft.**

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

workflow.name: Keyword To Blog Post Automation Template

parameters.content:
## Item Extraction
Receive content ideas through webhook and process each one

## Workflow explanation

*last updated: 11.08.2025*

### Preparation 

1. *(In Excel)* you set the keyword you want to generate content for on **Prioritized = yes**
2. *(In Excel)* you click on **Prepare Content** and the workflow will be triggered automatically

## Workflow functionality

### 1. Receive Data and prepare runs
1. Webhook receives the prioritized rows from the google sheet
2. it separates each row and extracts the actual keyword
2.1 it updated the row in google sheets that the automation has started

### 2. Get real-time SERP results from Google
1. Query a custom Search Engine and search for the target keyword
2. Split the SERP results into separate items
3. Get the actual real-time data from the website
4. Extract the text from the web page

### 3. AI Article Analysis
1. Analyse each text with AI. Get content structure and additional information.
2. Aggregate all analyzed articles separately
3. Create a SEO optimized Content Brief by comparing analyzed texts, identify content gaps etc.
4. Create a content draft from the Content Brief with AI

#### 4. Publish and update google sheet
1. Publish the content draft directly to your WordPress Website (still a draft)
2. Update Google Sheet 



## Setup
1. Copy Excel Template
2. Add your webhook to the Google Script
3. Create Custom Search API and connect via API key
4. Add your Claude API Key 
5. Connect to your WordPress website


### Full Setup Guide ###
https://opaque-face-45b.notion.site/Content-Automation-Pipeline-Walkthrough-221f1bceaabe808fb4efdc7c7be71bac

## Update Excel

Uddating the rows that are being processed

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "contentFormat": "listicle | how-to | guide | comparison | opinion | review | other",
  "contentType": "informational | commercial | transactional | navigational",
  "intentClues": [
    "e.g. how to", 
    "best tools", 
    "buy", 
    "guide", 
    "vs", 
    "tutorial", 
    "top 10"
  ],
  "averageWordCount": 0,
  "headings": [
    "H1 Title Example",
    "H2 Subtopic One",
    "H2 Subtopic Two",
    "H3 Nested Topic"
  ],
  "subtopics": [
    "Definition of X",
    "Benefits of Y",
    "How to do Z",
    "Common mistakes"
  ],
  "summaryTakeaways": [
    "Key takeaway 1",
    "Key takeaway 2",
    "Key takeaway 3"
  ],
  "answeredQuestions": [
    "What is X?",
    "How does Y work?",
    "Why is Z important?"
  ],
  "uniqueAngles": [
    "Case study from a startup using X",
    "Comparison to real-world analogy",
    "Includes visuals that others don‚Äôt"
  ],
  "contentGaps": [
    "No examples of practical implementation",
    "Missed current 2024 data updates",
    "Lacked pros and cons comparison"
  ]
}

{
  "targetKeyword": "your keyword here",
  "searchIntent": "informational | commercial | etc.",
  "recommendedFormat": "how-to | listicle | etc.",
  "idealLength": "1200‚Äì1500 words",
  "targetAudience": "e.g. SaaS founders, content creators",
  "titleSuggestion": "Best Tools for Automating Content Repurposing in 2024",
  "metaDescription": "Discover the top tools and workflows to repurpose YouTube content into blogs, social posts, and more.",
  "outline": [
    "Introduction",
    "Why Content Repurposing Matters",
    "Top Tools to Use",
    "How to Set Up an Automation Flow",
    "Common Mistakes to Avoid",
    "Conclusion"
  ],
  "mustIncludeSubtopics": [
    "Benefits of content repurposing",
    "Overview of tools like Repurpose.io, Zapier, n8n",
    "Step-by-step setup guide"
  ],
  "answeredQuestions": [
    "How do I turn a YouTube video into a blog post?",
    "What tools automate content repurposing?"
  ],
  "uniqueAngle": "Focus on a solo creator‚Äôs use case using free/low-cost tools",
  "contentGapsToFill": [
    "Most competitors don‚Äôt explain setup steps clearly",
    "None include a downloadable automation template"
  ],
  "ctaSuggestion": "Download the free workflow template + join my newsletter"
}

messageValues.message:
You are a seasonsed SEO professional and Text Analyser with some deep insights into helpful content. Whenever you get a text, I want you to analyse and understand the text.  Then, I want you to extract the following from each text: 
1. the ContentFormat,  which is either a listicle, how-to, guide, comparision, opinion, review, or other. 
2. the ContentType, which is either informational, commercial, transactional or navigational
3. the IntentClues, which can be how-to, best tools, buy, guide, vs, tutorial, ranking, top 10,
4. the AverageWordCount, which is the average word length of the text
5. all the headings, h1,h2,h3, up to h6 if necessary. And, if possible, also Add the hX tag before the heading
6. all the subtopics: definitions of x, benefits of y, how to do.. and so on
7. a list of key-takeaways.
8. a list of answered questions in the text
9. the UniqueAngles of the text. for example case studies, comparisons to real-world scenarios, etc.
10. a list of contentGaps that you see in the text.

You are an expert SEO content strategist. Your task is to analyze a list of SERP summaries (from top-ranking pages for a keyword) and generate a high-quality content brief to guide the writing of a new blog post that is more useful and competitive than existing content.  

Each SERP summary is structured in JSON and contains insights about a competing article, including content format, content type, headings, subtopics, summary takeaways, answered questions, unique angles, and content gaps.  

Use this information to: 
- Identify the dominant content format and intent 
- Suggest a competitive and original structure 
- Fill in the content gaps identified across competitors 
- Highlight what to include and what to improve 
- Suggest a title, meta description, outline, subtopics, and CTA 
- Focus on user value and differentiation  

Return the output as a single JSON object with the following structure:  {   "targetKeyword": "string",   "searchIntent": "string",   "recommendedFormat": "string",   "idealLength": "string",   "targetAudience": "string",   "titleSuggestion": "string",   "metaDescription": "string",   "outline": ["h2 header one", "h2 header two","h3 sub-header two-one", "..."],   "mustIncludeSubtopics": ["topic 1", "topic 2", "..."],   "answeredQuestions": ["question 1", "question 2", "..."],   "uniqueAngle": "string",   "contentGapsToFill": ["gap 1", "gap 2", "..."],   "ctaSuggestion": "string" }  Use clear, specific language in your output. Be strategic, not generic.

You are a seasoned SEO blog writer and technical content creator. Your writing style is warm, human, and easy to understand ‚Äî like you're explaining things to a curious and smart 16-year-old. You combine technical depth with clarity and a dash of quirkiness. You're speaking to solopreneurs, developers, and technically minded professionals. The goal is to educate, inform, and sometimes lightly entertain.

You will receive:
- A main keyword
- A content brief in JSON format
- A list of summarized top-ranking articles from the first page of Google (also in JSON format)
- A preferred content structure, such as ‚Äúhow-to guide‚Äù or ‚Äúlisticle‚Äù

You must understand the content brief and all provided article summaries before drafting anything.

Your tasks:

1. Generate a fresh, SEO-friendly title, primarily based on the brief, but also informed by top articles.

2. Create an outline using <h2> and <h3> headers. Make sure each section is relevant to the keyword and useful for the reader.
- If a header doesn‚Äôt make sense, leave it out.
- Follow the format and tone requested in the structure parameter (e.g., how-to guide, opinion, etc.)

3. For each <h2> and <h3>:
- List a few bullet points on what should be covered and from what angle.
- Write a draft paragraph for each bullet point.

4. Whenever appropriate, include examples, data, or references.
- If you can‚Äôt find any directly, add a placeholder like [add example here] or [research link for XYZ] ‚Äî this helps the human editor finish the post efficiently.


Important notes:

üîö Final Output Format (IMPORTANT)
Output only the HTML text

Do NOT return markdown, YAML, or any explanation.
Do NOT include "output" or "response" keys.
Do NOT return a code block. just the raw html text

parameters.content:
## SERP Extraction
Get the SERPS from Google for given Keyword
